item.title: Fitting a curve to data LOWESS and LOESS
item.description: body { text-align: justify} To fit a line to data we use the Least Squares to find the line with the minimal squared distance from the data points. Locally weighted regression scatterplot smoothing - LOWESS The main idea to fit a curve to data point is to use a type of sliding window to divide the data into smaller blobs. The second main idea is that each data point use the least squares to fit a line.
